review: I really didn't read the description well on this product.  I assumed that it essentially displayed everything from an ipad or iphone onto the tv.  I thought I could watch my videos, look at photos and movies etc if I wanted. BUT, Chromecast ONLY works as an app on the i device that pushes either Netflix or youtube to the TV through wifi or Bluetooth. For me essentially useless.  Maybe some day they will unlock other abilities but for now I can use my PS3 or 4 to do the same thing as this...for free

author: Elliot's Review

review: I bought a Chromecast at release, as was disappointed for months as we waited for support that extended past Netflix. At the time of this writing, it now supports all our favorite streaming services: Pandora, HBO Go, Hulu, Netflix. The only one we're waiting for still is Amazon Prime (if it ever will come). For $30-35, this device is incredible. We have one that we use on an old flatscreen monitor as a bedroom TV. We have another one in the living room for our main TV. Since we both have android phones and a tablet, we use those to control it with absolute ease.
author: Matt

review: For all of the devices in 2013, I think that this one has been my favorite. I was one of the early adopters, i.e. I bought it on announcement day. I was extremely impressed from day one. Even initially, setup was easy (now, with the Chromecast app updated, it's cake) and the supported app library is increasing rapidly. This was how my fiancee and I watched Netflix, how I watched YouTube videos, and how we play music for company over to our apartment. I am often asked about it, and I refer many people to it.And let's not forget that price. $35? I couldn't resist at that price, and I would not count it as a loss if I had disliked the Chromecast.All in all, I highly recommend it. The app does the set up for you, so it's very simple. And all you do is press the Cast icon (a rectangle with an angled WiFi signal in the bottom left corner) in a supported app (which are quite a few now), and you're watching the video on your TV.As for those complaining about not streaming from your Android gallery: this is a Google product, and closed right now, so they can do what they want. Do not rate the PRODUCT poorly, despite you saying that you liked it until Google blocked Gallery streaming. They will be releasing the SDK soon, so experienced dev's can go away at it. It's stupid to rate a product as 1-star that you said was good until the parent company did something that you didn't like. It's Google's product, Google's ecosystem, and Google's choice when to release the SDK.
